page.title: 17More about Yaxham Church
page.content: A new bell was given in 1957 when the bells were rehung on a steel frame.The concrete turret stairs go anticlock- wise.The roof of the Lady chapel(or south aisle) is covered with plaster which looks like real boards.The pews have animals carved on the arm rests and were given to the church after the first world war.Infront of the entrance to the belfry is a beautiful font,one of the best in Norfolk;a copy of which is in Cromer church.The chancel screen is very old.The screen by the south aisle was given by the Reverend John Trevelyan,the rector at that time,in thanks for the safe return of his son from the first world war. The church has normal Sunday services and runs a Sunday School for children. The church is part of a group of parishes including Mattishall
